column4: And my mouse is frozen as we speak, which is why I'm doing the BIOS upgrade in the first place
make sure that the disc gets verified before using.
how do I do that?
what are you using to burn the disc?
Ubuntu 9.04
yes i did
it was verified?
I don't see anything in terminal about it having been verified. How do I know?
the file type is iso right?
Yes
but you used the terminal to start the burn?
yes i did
why didn't you just double click it to burn it?

reason 1: my instructions were for the command line. reason 2: My mouse is unresponsive because I need to update my bios. Look it up. https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HardwareSupportMachinesDesktopsDellDimensionNSeries
what are the rest of the instructions to flash the bios?
I'm taking it a step at a time. I haven't figured out the rest of the instructions yet.
I shouldn't be doing this at all, but I really want to get ubuntu running on here.
Flashing a bios is only scary when the disc is not verified and has a problem. I had a copy of the ubuntu live cd I downloaded and burnt without verification.
you know how to use md5sum?
I just did it and got the md5sum of the iso file. how do I check the cd?
md5sum /dev/cdrom.
Input/output error
when you did the md5sum?
yes
what is the size of the disc files?
is it the same size as the iso (within a few bytes)?
that is a good idea
is that info the same as the iso?
rerun the md5sum on the iso now.
oh of course. okay here I go
kinja-sheep: checksums don't match
then you might want to reburn it. What commands did you use to start the burn?
I used the ones listed at number 3 on this page: http://www.linuxinsight.com/how-to-flash-motherboard-bios-from-linux-no-dos-windows-no-floppy-drive.html
what was the size of the disc after burning?
I'm restarting. I'll check when I log in
Okay, now how do I know if the file downloaded from the Dell site okay?
I can't find a checksum on their site.
the file from them is good. When the burner doesn't verify the data you run the risk of failed burn on that disc.
I just checked the CD and the iso. the iso is 1.8 M and the CD is 1.4. How can that be?
the iso file has that much more info to work like it does.
what is wrong with the computer you are on now to burn the disc?
I'd have no idea how to create a floppy image and burn it to a cd on this computer. iBook G4 running osx tiger
has the computer with the problem had any problems with the cdrom or power or anything else?
no. and we're not having a thunderstorm right now.
how bad do you need to do this??
I have to do it if I want to run linux on this box. I can't use it without a mouse.
then go ahead and start the reboot with the disc in it.
Here goes.
make sure that nothing interrupts the process.
yep
what is the bios you are using on that machine?
no the name.

the download site for the update is here:http://support.dell.com/support/downloads/download.aspx?c=us&cs=04&l=en&s=bsd&releaseid=R142795&SystemID=DIM_P4_C521&os=WW1&osl=en&deviceid=308&devlib=0&typecnt=1&vercnt=4&formatcnt=1&libid=1&fileid=190570
Dell Dimension System Bios?
what is the system doing now?
I just powered it off and started it up again to check the bios, but I missed the name.
did you flash it already?
no I didn't
I got as far as Welcome to FreeDos and the command prompt.
Can you walk me through flashing it?
when the system rebooted it should have taken you to a GUI
what files are on the disc?
boot.cat; fdoem.144
Just those two
what the model again?
Dell Dimension C521
one sec

I'd feel a lot more confident if the instructions at http://www.linuxinsight.com/how-to-flash-motherboard-bios-from-linux-no-dos-windows-no-floppy-drive.html didn't assume so much and explained what was actually happening in more detail.
lol
what was the name and type of the file that you got from dell?
Will it kill my computer?
the disc doesn't work due to missing info from the boot sector of the disc. It was not burnt right.
Can you walk me through the instructions I'm trying to follow, so I could have feedback at each point?
kinja-sheep: you still with me?
yes. the mouse doesn't work at all?
it works for awhile after login, then freezes.
one sec I think I found a different way to do it.
the exe needs to be extracted first
Why thank you my friend. now how do I do that?
you downloaded the exe file from dell right?
yep
do you have unzip?
I don't know
can you download it on that system?
you can get it from here: http://packages.ubuntu.com
no I don't have an internet connection with this system.
can you get it onto a flash drive from another computer?
yes I can
download it from http://packages.ubuntu.com and save it on the flash drive
http://packages.ubuntu.com/ is terribly slow for some reason.
it keeps timingout on me
packages.ubuntu.com for anything is not coming up for me. What about you?
you need that package to continue.
you might have it on your system already. try and type unzip in terminal
